result.execSummary:
The defendant Charleigh T. Clause was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Charleigh T. Clause in court with attorney Jamy Richard Johansen.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court  withholds sentence, 1 year probation conditions of probation fine $100.00 plus costs $589.00,  expunge upon sucessful completetion of probation,    Absolute Sobriety,   No drug use without a valid prescription. Bond corrected to be $5000 signature bond as previously ordered.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
